answer_html: \(T_2(x)=2+\frac{1}{12}(x-8) - \frac{1}{288}(x-8)^2\) (This is simplified enough for the purpose of Taylor polynomials).
answer_latex:
$T_2(x)=2+\frac{1}{12}(x-8) - \frac{1}{288}(x-8)^2$  (This is
simplified enough for the purpose of Taylor polynomials).
hints_html:
Recall that the general forumla for a second degree Taylor polynomial is:

\[\begin{aligned} T_2(x)=f(a)+f'(a)(x-a)+\frac{f''(a)}{2}(x-a)^2\end{aligned}\]
hints_raw:
Recall that the general forumla for a second degree Taylor polynomial is:
:<math>
T_2(x)=f(a)+f'(a)(x-a)+\frac{f''(a)}{2}(x-a)^2
</math>
question: 4 (a)
sols_html:
The general forumla for a second degree Taylor polynomial is:

\[\begin{aligned} T_2(x)=f(a)+f'(a)(x-a)+\frac{f''(a)}{2}(x-a)^2\end{aligned}\]

To find this for \(f(x)\), we need to first find \(f'(x)\) and \(f''({x})\):

\[\begin{aligned} f'(x)=(\sqrt[3]{x})'=(x^{1/3})'=\frac{1}{3}x^{-2/3}\end{aligned}\]

\[\begin{aligned} f''(x)=(\frac{1}{3}x^{-2/3})'=-\frac{2}{9}x^{-5/3}\end{aligned}\]

And now we can evaluate at a = 8 to get

\[\begin{aligned} f(8)=8^{1/3}=2\end{aligned}\]

\[\begin{aligned} f'(8)=\frac{1}{3}8^{-2/3}=\frac{1}{3} \cdot \frac{1}{4} = \frac{1}{12}\end{aligned}\]

\[\begin{aligned} f''(8)=-\frac{2}{9}8^{-5/3} = -\frac{2}{9} \cdot \frac{1}{2^5} = -\frac{2}{9 \cdot 32} = - \frac{1}{144}\end{aligned}\]

We can now plug these in to the equation for the second Taylor polynomial and obtain:

\[\begin{aligned} T_2(x)=2+\frac{1}{12}(x-8) - \frac{1}{288}(x-8)^2\end{aligned}\]

(This is simplified enough for the purpose of Taylor polynomials).

statement_html:
Full-Solution Problems. In questions 2-8, justify your answers and show all your work. If a box is provided, write your final answer there. Simplification of answers is not required unless explicitly stated.

Let T2(x) be the second degree Taylor polynomial about a = 8 for

\[\begin{aligned} f(x)= \sqrt[3]{x}.\end{aligned}\]

Find T2(x) and simplify your answer.

:<math> f(x)= \sqrt[3]{x}. </math>

Find ''T''<sub>2</sub>(''x'') and simplify your answer.
